author: Wissam M. Khoury
comment: Very nice idea and I love that now I can see pictures and listen to voice messages on my wear. The only issue I have is on the t9 keyboard when u want to type a word with letters from the same block it doesn't switch from one letter to another.
title: Great effort

author: Alex Filacchione
comment: After much trial and error, I finally got this working...  and while I can receive messages and reply to them so long as I do so before they get dismissed, I cannot initiate messages, nor reply to messages that have been dismissed.  So 50% of the use cases for this are basically not possible.  IDK why the devs would deliberately limit their app like this.  And the alternative apps aren't any better.  I wish someone would look at Coffee's UI and functionality and use that as a model for a good wearable messaging app.    Uninstalled.

author: Cheryl Ho
comment: Tried on huawei watch.. can type and reply whatsapp on the watch using the app, but the reply is only sent when whatsapp is opened on the phone.. kinda defeats the purpose of the app.. thankfully tried using free demo

author: Lauren Cataldi
comment: I use it for Facebook Messenger on my Huawei watch and I haven't had a problem

title: Seems like a quality app

author: Ruben Kan
comment: I enabled in the app but when replying in Gmail or Hangouts, the chosen keyboard didn't show up. Using Nexus 6 and OG Moto 360.

reply.author: Dream Code
reply.content: Please verify that: You actually enabled the app. The top item will say "Enabled". If not, just touch on it and tick the box next to the app name; You are trying to reply on the notification generated by Quick. As the app generates its own, they may appear below the original ones. Try scrolling down to see if the new one is there.

title: Doesn't work for me
